intro: Urophyllum urdanetense, commonly known as the Urdanet bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture, while its stems are upright and often branched. Urophyllum urdanetense is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
